tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE employee_turnover (
  employee_id INT,
  employee_name VARCHAR(255),
  department VARCHAR(100),
  join_date DATE,
  reason_for_attrition TEXT
);
CREATE TABLE Employee (employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(50), department VARCHAR(50), hire_date DATE, attrition_reason VARCHAR(100));
CREATE TABLE TurnoverRate (rate_id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT, turnover_rate DECIMAL(5,2), year INT);
CREATE TABLE AttritionReasons (reason_id INT PRIMARY KEY, reason_description VARCHAR(200));

CREATE TABLE employees (
  employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_name VARCHAR(50),
  department VARCHAR(50),
  hire_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE turnover_rates (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_id INT,
  turnover_rate DECIMAL(5,2),
  turnover_reason TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE attrition_reasons (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  employee_id INT,
  attrition_date DATE,
  reason TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE departments (
  department_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  department_name VARCHAR(50),
  manager_id INT
)
CREATE TABLE Employee { id INT PRIMARY KEY, name STRING NOT NULL, department STRING NOT NULL, hire_date DATE NOT NULL, termination_date DATE, reason_termination STRING }
CREATE TABLE Department { id INT PRIMARY KEY, name STRING NOT NULL, location STRING NOT NULL }
CREATE TABLE TurnoverReason { id INT PRIMARY KEY, reason_name STRING NOT NULL, description STRING }
CREATE TABLE TurnoverRate { id INT PRIMARY KEY, employee_id INT NOT NULL, turnover_date DATE NOT NULL, turnover_rate FLOAT NOT NULL }
CREATE TABLE Report { id INT PRIMARY KEY, report_date DATE NOT NULL, report_content STRING }
